intro: Corallodiscus lanuginosus var. minutus, commonly known as the woolly coral disk, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its small, woolly leaves and clusters of tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually pale blue or violet, and it blooms during the warmer months. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
